backend/main.mo: Main Motoko actor that stores demo booking requests in a Map, exposes `submitDemoRequest`, `getAllDemoRequests`, and `getAllDemoRequestsByEmail` query/update methods, and uses a migration hook to upgrade from the old actor state.
backend/migration.mo: Migration module that defines the old and new actor state types and provides a `run` function to transform legacy email-list state into the new `demoRequests` Map structure.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report mapping two implemented features — the demo booking form UI and the `useSubmitDemoRequest` React Query hook — to their source files, components, and test IDs.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: JSON document containing one-sentence summaries of every frontend source file, serving as a reference for the project's component and hook structure.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind base stylesheet defining CSS custom properties for light and dark color themes using OKLCH values for backgrounds, foregrounds, borders, and chart colors.
frontend/index.html: Minimal HTML entry point that mounts the React app into a `#root` div and loads the `main.tsx` module script.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React component that composes all marketing page sections in order, including the new `DemoBookingSection` placed between `CTASection` and `EmailCaptureSection`.
frontend/src/components/CTASection.tsx: Mid-page CTA section with a dark gradient card featuring a 'Start Your Free Trial' button scrolling to `#email-capture` and a 'Schedule a Demo' button smooth-scrolling to `#demo-booking`.
frontend/src/components/DemoBookingSecti: Demo booking form section collecting full name, work email, company, team size (dropdown), and preferred contact time, with client-side validation and submission via the `useSubmitDemoRequest` hook, showing an inline success message on completion.
frontend/src/components/EmailCaptureSect: Early-access email capture form with validation, loading/error states, and a success confirmation message, integrated with the `useCaptureEmail` mutation hook.
Renders a 2x2 grid of feature cards (AI Analysis, Smart Shortlisting, Bias-Reduction, Hiring Insights) with icons, descriptions, and tags for the HR Buddy platform features section.
frontend/src/components/Footer.tsx: Displays the site footer with brand logo, tagline, social links (LinkedIn, X), and four columns of navigation links (Product, Company, Resources, Legal) on a dark background.
frontend/src/components/HeroSection.tsx: Full-screen hero section with headline copy, trust points, CTA buttons linking to email capture and how-it-works sections, and a dashboard mockup image on the right.
frontend/src/components/HowItWorksSectio: Three-step process section (Upload & Define, AI Screens & Ranks, Review & Decide) displayed as cards with a connecting line on desktop and arrow connectors on mobile.
frontend/src/components/MetricsSection.t: Dark-themed metrics section displaying four key statistics (75% faster screening, 10K+ candidates, 92% satisfaction, 3× accuracy) in a responsive grid.
frontend/src/components/Navbar.tsx: Fixed top navigation bar with scroll-aware background, desktop nav links with smooth-scroll, Sign In and Start Free Trial CTAs, and a collapsible mobile menu.
Social-proof section showing six placeholder partner company logos as styled abbreviation badges in a centered, grayscale flex row.
frontend/src/components/TestimonialsSect: Renders a testimonials section with three customer quote cards, each featuring a star rating, blockquote, and author avatar with initials.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Custom hook that creates and caches an ICP backend actor (authenticated or anonymous) using React Query, and invalidates dependent queries when the actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides an InternetIdentityProvider and useInternetIdentity hook for managing DFINITY Internet Identity authentication state, including login, logout, and identity persistence.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Exports two React Query mutation hooks—useSubmitDemoRequest and useCaptureEmail—that call the backend actor to store demo requests and early-access email signups.
frontend/src/index.css: Global stylesheet that imports Google Fonts, configures Tailwind base/components/utilities, defines CSS custom properties for the HR Buddy teal/amber/charcoal brand theme, and adds utility classes like text-gradient-teal and section-padding.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that mounts the React app wrapped in QueryClientProvider and InternetIdentityProvider.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration defining custom fonts (Sora/Inter), an extended oklch-based color palette for primary teal, amber, and slate scales, and enabling typography, container-queries, and animate plugins.
project_state.json: Project state manifest tracking the HR Buddy marketing site's version, architectural notes, known issues, and a list of implemented features with their requirement IDs.
